result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley W Phillips

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:07 PM Defendant Bradley W Phillips in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Bradley W Phillips.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson and Jacob Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a jury trial in case 20CF487.
Defense indicates the defendant is ready to proceed with a COP. Defense was recently obtained in newest case file and is seeking more time to go over the case with the defendant. Makes statements on the record. 
State puts concerns on the record. Does not object to cases being resolved or to proceed with jury trial but indicates if defendant pleads today in case 20CF487, he should go into custody today. Is willing to extend a global offer for all three case files today if the defendant pleads today's date. Puts offer on the record. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer is correct. 
Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 20CF487
Plea - Ct. 1: GUILTY
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis.
BTC: GUILTY. Ct. 2 is dismissed outright; 
Firearm warning given; 
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  

BTC: Matter set over for sentencing. PSI ordered. 
Cases 21CF1511 and 22CF696 are dismissed but read in. 

***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
To track in same branch as open cases

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley W Phillips appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Bradley W Phillips. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
